Defining the neighborhood size

Blocks consist of sequences of points in which each point is within the neighborhood of the previous one. FISH calculates the size of the neighborhood for all points based on the total number of points and cells in the grid. The probability of a cell containing a point is . From this, and from an adjustable parameter (see 3.1), FISH calculates the size of the neighborhood.
